question: In Python, exceptions are runtime errors that can cause a program to ________ if not handled.
To handle exceptions in Python, you use the ________ block.
The ________ block is used to execute code when no exceptions occur.
The ________ block is used to execute cleanup code regardless of whether an exception occurred.
To raise an exception manually in Python, you use the ________ keyword.
User-defined exceptions in Python are created by defining a class that inherits from the ________ class.
In Python, you can handle different types of exceptions by using multiple ________ blocks.
The ________ statement is used to catch all exceptions, but it is generally discouraged because it hides unexpected errors.
To prevent a program from crashing due to a division by zero, you can use a ________ block to handle the ZeroDivisionError.
